articles.headline: Top FTX Executive Says Sam Bankman-Fried Used Customer Money for ‘Excess’ Spending
articles.snippet: Nishad Singh, testifying at Mr. Bankman-Fried’s fraud trial, said FTX customer deposits were used to buy luxury real estate and to pay athletes like Tom Brady and Steph Curry for endorsement deals.
articles.abstract: Nishad Singh, testifying at Mr. Bankman-Fried’s fraud trial, said FTX customer deposits were used to buy luxury real estate and to pay athletes like Tom Brady and Steph Curry for endorsement deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: Nishad Singh, a former top executive at the once high-flying FTX crypto exchange, testified on Monday that his former boss, Sam Bankman-Fried, had used customer money to engage in large and extravagant spending sprees that “reeked of excess.”
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein, J. Edward Moreno and David Yaffe-Bellany

articles.headline: Confusion and Frustration Reign at Egypt-Gaza Border
articles.snippet: Told they could escape Gaza, scores of people with foreign passports gathered at the only border crossing into Egypt, only to find it still closed, as diplomatic efforts floundered.
articles.abstract: Told they could escape Gaza, scores of people with foreign passports gathered at the only border crossing into Egypt, only to find it still closed, as diplomatic efforts floundered.
articles.lead_paragraph: Before dawn on Monday, the U.S. Embassy in Jerusalem sent an email to Americans trapped in Gaza, suggesting they head for the border with Egypt and offering the prospect of escape.
articles.byline: By Matthew Rosenberg and Emma Bubola

articles.headline: Biden to Visit Israel as Gaza’s Crisis Worsens Under Siege
articles.snippet: President Biden will make the extraordinary trip on Wednesday as Israel readies a possible invasion of Gaza in response to the worst terrorist attacks in its history.
articles.abstract: President Biden will make the extraordinary trip on Wednesday as Israel readies a possible invasion of Gaza in response to the worst terrorist attacks in its history.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden plans to visit Israel on Wednesday, an extraordinary trip to the grieving nation as it prepares to invade the neighboring Gaza Strip, which has fallen into a desperate humanitarian crisis with two million people trapped and critical supplies dwindling.
articles.byline: By Hiba Yazbek and Edward Wong

articles.headline: China Invested $1 Trillion to Gain Global Influence. Can That Go On?
articles.snippet: Xi Jinping enhanced China’s sway in the world by lending money for infrastructure. Now he’s collecting debts and rethinking his signature aid initiative.
articles.abstract: Xi Jinping enhanced China’s sway in the world by lending money for infrastructure. Now he’s collecting debts and rethinking his signature aid initiative.
articles.lead_paragraph: China’s top leader, Xi Jinping, founded the Belt and Road Initiative a decade ago to use the country’s economic might to enlarge its geopolitical heft and counter the influence of the United States and other industrialized democracies.

articles.headline: Netanyahu Opted for Limited Strikes in the Past. This Is His First All-Out War.
articles.snippet: In his 15 years as Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu has been seen as risk-averse, avoiding open-ended military engagements and peace initiatives.
articles.abstract: In his 15 years as Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu has been seen as risk-averse, avoiding open-ended military engagements and peace initiatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: “We are at war,” Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared after Hamas fighters carried out harrowing attacks on Israeli civilians.

articles.headline: Those Doritos Too Expensive? More Stores Offer Their Own Alternatives.
articles.snippet: Retailers are expanding their own private-label food and beverage offerings, attracting customers looking for less expensive options.
articles.abstract: Retailers are expanding their own private-label food and beverage offerings, attracting customers looking for less expensive options.
articles.lead_paragraph: The snack chips had become pretty pricey.

articles.headline: A Higher Monthly Payment, but Less Square Footage
articles.snippet: Homebuilders are responding to rising interest rates with an innovation: a small house in the traditionally spacious exurbs.
articles.abstract: Homebuilders are responding to rising interest rates with an innovation: a small house in the traditionally spacious exurbs.

articles.headline: U.S. Tightens China’s Access to Advanced Chips for Artificial Intelligence
articles.snippet: The further limits on shipments could cripple Beijing’s A.I. ambitions and dampen revenues for U.S. chip makers, analysts said.
articles.abstract: The further limits on shipments could cripple Beijing’s A.I. ambitions and dampen revenues for U.S. chip makers, analysts said.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration on Tuesday announced additional limits on sales of advanced semiconductors by American firms, shoring up restrictions issued last October to limit China’s progress on supercomputing and artificial intelligence.

articles.headline: Hamas Hijacked Victims’ Social Media Accounts to Spread Terror
articles.snippet: The use of hostages’ Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp accounts to livestream attacks and issue death threats is a new tactic, experts said.
articles.abstract: The use of hostages’ Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp accounts to livestream attacks and issue death threats is a new tactic, experts said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly after Hamas attacked Israel on Oct. 7, friends and relatives of Gali Shlezinger Idan, who lived in a kibbutz near the Gaza border, received frantic messages to check her Facebook page.
articles.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Talya Minsberg

articles.headline: Ukraine Uses Powerful American-Supplied Missiles for First Time
articles.snippet: Ukrainian forces attacked two key Russian air bases behind enemy lines on Tuesday, using American-made long-range missiles known as ATACMS, a U.S. official said.
articles.abstract: Ukrainian forces attacked two key Russian air bases behind enemy lines on Tuesday, using American-made long-range missiles known as ATACMS, a U.S. official said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ukraine’s forces used newly supplied American long-range missiles against Russia for the first time on Tuesday after President Biden overcame his longstanding reluctance to providing the weapons, permitting the Pentagon to deliver them covertly in the last few days, American officials said.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, Lara Jakes, Marc Santora, Constant Méheut and John Ismay

articles.headline: Jordan Falls Short as Republican Speaker Fight Continues
articles.snippet: Twenty Republicans refused to support the hard-right Ohio Republican, leaving him without a majority as the party infighting stretched into a third week.
articles.abstract: Twenty Republicans refused to support the hard-right Ohio Republican, leaving him without a majority as the party infighting stretched into a third week.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our live updates for the House speaker vote.
